docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. David A. Paterson’s warning that he may lay off thousands of state workers if he cannot get unions to agree to a pay cut has aroused a fierce advertising campaign.

headline.seo: Paterson’s Threat to Cut 9,000 Jobs Puts Unions on Offensive
headline.main: Unions Go on Attack Over Paterson’s Layoff Threat
headline.print_headline: Unions Go on Attack Over Paterson’s Layoff Threat

docs.snippet: Gov. David A. Paterson’s warning that he may lay off thousands of state workers if he cannot get unions to agree to a pay cut has aroused a fierce advertising campaign.

docs.lead_paragraph: Broccoli sprouts seem to be able to control the bacteria that causes ulcers, a new study shows.

headline.seo: Broccoli Sprouts May Fight Germ Tied to Ulcers
headline.main: Regimens: Broccoli Sprouts May Be Germ Fighters
headline.print_headline: Broccoli Sprouts May Be Germ Fighters

docs.snippet: Broccoli sprouts seem to be able to control the bacteria that causes ulcers, a new study shows.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ramon Scruggs was indicted last year on charges he illegally wrote prescriptions to patients — including major league baseball players — for performance-enhancing drugs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Originally believed to be lost after infancy, calorie-burning brown fat has been discovered in adults.

headline.seo: Brown Fat Identified as Heat-Yielding Cells in Humans
headline.main: Calorie-Burning Fat? Studies Say You Have It
headline.print_headline: Human Fat Cell Burns Calories? Studies Say Yes

docs.snippet: Originally believed to be lost after infancy, calorie-burning brown fat has been discovered in adults.

docs.lead_paragraph: Anne Hubbard has not lost her job, house or savings, and she and her husband have always been conservative with money. But a few months ago, Ms. Hubbard, a graphic designer in Cambridge, Mass., began having panic attacks over the economy, struggling to breathe and seeing vivid visions of ''losing everything,'' she said.

headline.main: Recession Anxiety Seeps Into Everyday Lives

docs.abstract: Anxiety, depression, lack of sleep and stress over economy are troubling Americans of all ages everywhere, including many who have not suffered significant losses but who are worrying they will or are simply reacting to pervasive uncertainty; some are seeking counseling or medication for first time; others are resuming or increasing treatment or redirecting therapy for other issues onto economic anxiety; federal agencies have started Web site for people experiencing stress and are training counselors who usually assist people devastated by natural disasters to help people cope with economic one; New York Times/CBS Poll finds that Americans overwhelmingly think recession will last another year or more and that 70 percent of them are concerned that household member will be jobless; photos (M)
